p: To identify the phylogenetic position of E. pudingense, we downloaded the complete chloroplast genome sequences of 16 species from the NCBI GenBank database. MAFFT v7 (Katoh etÂ al. 2017) was used for sequence alignment, and then a maximum likelihood tree was constructed by using RAxML v8.2.10 (Stamatakis 2014) with Clematis terniflora as the outgroup ( Figure 1). The phylogenetic analysis revealed that E. pudingense closely clustered with E. elachyphyllum. Our study will provide essential data for future research on the phylogenetic and evolutionary relationship in Epimedium genus.
